poem:
### Lines Drawn

Borders pressed from ink and pen,  
three lands speak, the map amends.  
Whispers, louder than any shout,  
hope inked in treaties, drawn out.  
Across the globe, new lines are sown,  
a fragile peace in seeds they've grown.  
Yet every word, each line, each thread,  
seeks a home where futures tread.
